Author: pompompuringdom
Content:
# July 

# August - September 
**Nationwide Protests (Late Aug â†’ Sept)**
Mass demonstrations nationwide intensified from late August into September; Politicians' houses got raided.

**Pati Regency Uprising**
In Pati, Central Java, protests against massive local tax hikes turned into one of the biggest regional uprisings of the year.

**â€œ17+8 Peopleâ€™s Demandsâ€**
On 3â€“4 September, protest coalitions issued a set of 17 immediate + 8 long-term demands, crystallizing the movementâ€™s agenda.

**Major Cabinet Change**
On 8 September, Prabowo reshuffled again, notably replacing Finance Minister Sri Mulyani, underscoring political instability.

**MBG Food Poisoning Peaks**
From late September into October, clusters of mass food poisoning linked to MBG were reported, forming one of the yearâ€™s biggest humanitarian policy flops.

# October 
**E10 Ethanol Fuel Policy**
Early October, the government advanced E10 ethanol blending under its energy transition policy. Critics warned about inflationary risks and supply chain strain. â“ is this where shell then left?

# November
**Revision of Criminal Procedure Code (UU KUHAP)**
On 18 November, Parliament ratified an overhauled Criminal Procedure Code. Legal experts raised alarms about expanded police powers and reduced suspect rights.

# December 
**Major Flooding in Sumatra & Aceh**
Severe floods displaced tens of thousands; Indonesia announced billions in recovery funds needed.

**Forest & Land Fires**
Hotspot data in mid-December showed elevated fire activity mimicking crises from the dry season intensification.

**MBG Truck Collision in Jakarta**
In early December, an MBG meal transport truck crashed into a group of schoolchildren, killing and injuring dozens â€” one of the yearâ€™s most tragic policy-linked accidents.

**Volcanic Activity**
Multiple eruptions and geological hazards were officially logged across December, compounding disaster governance stress.
